name: Anomaly
description:
The galaxy is littered with beings that do not conform to humanity’s interpretation of reality. While not all merit the categorization of MONIST, these anomalies challenge what we understand about the very nature of the universe.

Encountering one of these entities is often a life-changing experience in the worst of ways. God help you if you do.

Anomalies interact with the battlefield and their opponents in uncanny ways. Their influence upon reality lingers upon their targets, rewriting their victims’ very natures. Use this template to grant an NPC unconventional controller-like abilities and unsettling effects that require player adaptation to overcome.

name: Brigand
description:
As long as capital remains essential to survival, there will be those who turn to dubious techniques to wrest it from those unprepared to protect it. Some rely upon brute force, while others instead leverage unconventional methods to exploit their marks’ vulnerabilities.

Brigands are a variant of the Pirate template (Lancer, p. 328). It trades raw damage in exchange for additional underhanded tactics and unexpected vectors of attack. Brigands aim to leave opponents vulnerable to follow-up from teammates, though their “improvisational” approach to mech-building leaves them vulnerable in turn.

name: Brisk
description: Some Lancer NPC classes possess abysmal Speed. As a result, they may struggle to get to a fight without assistance, especially if deployed as Reinforcements. The Brisk template is intended to alleviate this issue.

name: Chilled
description: The Chilled template is intended for use with the Recharge Heat optional rule. If NPCs with more than one Stress are left too vulnerable to Heat effects due to this rule, this template will lightly bump their Heat Caps to make the additional Heat manageable.

name: Formation
description: Formations are an alternative take on the Grunt template (Lancer, p. 327). This template transforms a single standard NPC into a group that acts on a shared turn, allowing the NPC to threaten a larger territory without increasing its total action output.

name: Prototype
description:
Every pattern group was once a prototype: Untested, unproven, unpredictable. Each a survivor of a thousand-thousand iterations, budding from a single “what if?” Not every idea has merit. Countless lie stillborn on the cutting room floor. But without the courage to ask that simple question, what hope is there for changing the status quo?

Anomalies are esoteric and strange. Brigands are scrappy and unscrupulous. Prototypes are novel and untested. They are the blood on the bleeding edge, fielding technology refined enough to be mass-produced but nascent enough to not have a pattern group assigned to them. This nebulous designation arms Prototypes with the element of surprise — at least until their Scans can be added to a database.
